lines: Good day.
Good day, #p.
These are dark times for Gondor.
These are dark times for Gondor, #p.
Men whisper of fell creatures spawning in the East, and tell tales of a nameless fear...
If you should chance upon a wild growth of westmansweed, you'd be wise to pick it and take it home.
I'd rather be down at the tavern right now.
They say the shadow of Mordor is growing in the East.
These are dark times. A great power is rising in the East.
How do you fare?
Do you have anything to drink?
There is little quite so beautiful as the sight of the Sun's first rays cast upon the white mountain-peaks.
Good day, #p! But do I mean to say that the day is good, or that it is a day to be good on?
We are truth-speakers, we Men of Gondor.
Gondor was once one of the greatest realms of Men. Yet today it is merely a land of crumbling brick, and false hearts...
What tidings do you carry?
Tell me, #p. What news of lands afar?
Are these the last days of Men? Once, Gondor was great, but with every passing day I fear more for our future.
There is a cold darkness coming down onto the realms of Men.
Tall ships and tall kings, three times three. What brought they from the foundered land, over the flowing sea? Seven stars, and seven stones, and one white tree.
They say those Southrons carry curved swords into battle. Curved swords!
I hope to see the glory of Gondor restored someday.
Gondor is not as great as it once was.
An evil is rising once more behind the walls of Mordor. I fear it shall be our doom.
Have you seen the Argonath, #p? They are a sight to behold!
Have you seen the Argonath, #p? When last I journeyed north, they had gone missing...
The vales of the Anduin are beautiful lands, almost rivalling the beauty of Gondor itself.
The White Tree is long since failed, yet our hearts still beat true.
It is said that the peaks of the White Mountains may be seen from anywhere one stands in Gondor.
I long to see the Swan Knights of Dor-en-Ernil ride into battle.
Stay far from the pines of Tawar-in-Drúedain, #p. Strange Men live there who worship stone and leaf.
If the beacons of the White Tower should be lit, then we will know at last that our doom has come.
The havens of Umbar were once part of our realm, but they have long since fallen into the hands of the Haradrim.
This country was a great kingdom in days of old, but those days have long passed us by...
Ah, sweet galenas! Such a beautiful, fragrant herb. One often finds it growing in these lands, #p.
The westmansweed of these fields is a wonderful and fragrant herb.
The hearts of Men may grow false, #p, but our lands are still as fair as ever.
This realm is called Stoningland in the tongue of Rohan. Well, we cannot say we lack for stone, #p.
Hello there, #p!
What news, #p?
The old tomb-mound of Elendil is named Halifirien in the tongue of Rohan. But his casket was sent to the Silent Street of the Stone City, five hundred years ago.
We built a wall around the fields of Pelennor to keep the Orc-raids out. We should do the same at Poros, if you ask me.

I have seen with my eyes the ruin of Osgiliath, where once was our capital city. But for five hundred years, that city has been host to naught but silent grief, a reminder of Gondor's darkening decline.
The scholars speak of days when Gondor was a shining jewel among the realms of Men. I fear those days are forever lost, #p.
Have you any fair tidings, #p?
Gondor has never since regained the glory it had during the days of the line of Anárion.
This country is my home, #p. I fear for us all in these dark days.
Many Men out of Ithilien and the South-lands sought refuge here, one hundred years ago. I hope that one day our host will march east and take back those haunted homelands!
Greetings, #p. What news do you bring to Gondor from afar?
Ah, #p! I believe we have met before. Or am I mistaken?
We wish for no strangers in the land at this time, unless they be mighty men of arms in whose faith and help we can trust.
Know now, #p, that we wish for no strangers in Gondor at this time.
Well met, #p!
Well met.
Do not be afraid, my friend #p. Rohan will come to our aid. They always come to our aid.
These are troubled times for our people. Darkness gathers in Mordor, and the lords of the White City are silent.
In my heart, #p, I still dream of a day when the Kings will return to the throne of Gondor.
I long to see a King on the throne of Gondor again.
I have heard stories that the Kings may one day return and rule Gondor once more. But those are just folk-tales; they cannot be true...
Gondor. Ah, Gondor. The great South-kingdom of old, once! But now, #p, this is our long dwindling. The twilight of the West.
Men from the outlands are coming to the heartlands, away from conflict. They bring trouble, but I think we'll manage.
Come, #p, tell me a tale to cheer my heart.
I should warn you, #p. Gondor is not as it once was.
You don't look much like a Man of Gondor, #p. You're not from the South, are you?
Welcome to Gondor.
Welcome to Gondor, #p.
Gondor welcomes you, #p.
Welcome, #p. Would that you had come to Gondor in happier days.
It is a shame you could not have come to Gondor in happier days, #p.
I wish that I could welcome you to Gondor in happier times.
Welcome, #p. What business brings you to Gondor?
Good day, #p! Welcome to the land of Gondor.
You come on a fine day, #p. The Orcs have not raided our lands in more than a week.
You may have travelled far to see Gondor, #p. Yet I think you have found it in dark days.
You're not from around these parts, are you, #p?
Good day, my lord #p. Is there anything I can do for you?
Good day, my lady #p. Is there anything I can do for you?
Fine day for it.
Darkness is gathering on Gondor. And, #p, it seems rain-clouds are gathering on the horizon.
You won't be doing any crimes here!
You are no friend of Gondor, #p.
We don't look kindly on criminals here!
This is a fell hour for Gondor indeed!
